oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SURFACE WAVES ON ENCLOSED BODIES OF WATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Burling, R.W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wind-generated waves
reservoir
air temperature
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A series of observations was made on the surface waves on a reservoir half a mile wide and one mile in length in winds between 250 and 1300 cm/sec. A slight increase in wave period, and a considerable increase in wave height were observed when the air was colder than the surface water. The data obtained are compared with previous observations made on Abbott's Lagoon in California.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 5 (1954): Proceedings of 5th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Grenoble, France, 1954.; 1
